fields.summary: Column comments with "\n" character "corrupts" table metadata

comments.body: Solution depends on the HIVE-14013 patch, since I think it would be a good idea, to have the unicode parameters displayed correctly as well
Wrong type of link

Thanks [~niklaus.xiao].
For human use, your solution is perfect, but we had to parse the response by code.
My example above is clearly a bug, which should be solved. My proposed solution is to print out an escaped \n for this scenario.
The proposed patch
[~pvary] Seems "show create table" output doesn't escape the "\n" in the test. Is that expected?

Good catch [~aihuaxu]. I realised that myself, and in the process to updating the patch :)
Thanks anyway!!!

ATTACHMENT ID: 12816391 - PreCommit-HIVE-MASTER-Build
The same patch again - I do not think the errors are caused by the patch

[~pvary] I notice that we are calling HiveStringUtils.esapeJava(escapeHiveCommand(string)). Does it make sense to move HiveStringUtils.esapeJava() call inside escapeHiveCommand() so it will control escaping characters in one place?

As discussed I merged the escapeCommand with the HiveStringUtils.escapeJava.

Created a new function in HiveStringUtils, so it can be reused.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12820998 - PreCommit-HIVE-MASTER-Build

Regenerated the diff, since I do not know why it was not recognized.

The decision on the CLI formatted comment handling is still required
[~pvary] Yeah. You may need to rebase to the latest change. Do you need to generate the new baseline for your new test case?

I rebased and run the qtests. It seems ok now - we will see the result not too soon :)
What I am not sure about, how to handle the CLI/BeeLine differences here.
CLI uses formatted outputting, which specifically displays comments with \n in new lines, but only in column comments, and not in table comments.

Probably the nicest solution would be to keep the \n-s as newlines in CLI mode in table comments as well, so at least in CLI every newline would remain a newline, and in BeeLine every newline would be a \n.
I see. Sure. Seems reasonable to make such change.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12830464 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
+1. The patch looks good to me.

[~pvary] I was about to commit the patch. But I noticed that in some files such as alter_table_invalidate_column_stats.q.out, seems we append some empty new line after {{# col_name             data_type               comment }}. Is that expected? Can you double check that part? If it's good, I will commit it later.

[~aihuaxu] I have checked those lines you mentioned.
The difference between the new and the original lines is that in the new version there are whitespaces at the end of every cell to make the width of the last column the same as every other column. The new line was there before the patch.
Pushed to master. Thanks Peter for the contribution.
I got a customer with Hive 1.2.1.2.4 who has the same problem. Was this fix backported into 1.x stream?
[~trinevo]: This is fixed only in 2.3.0 and not backported to 1.x line, since the solution depends on HIVE-14013 which fix is 2.3.0 only too...
